DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of infection associated with primary immunodeficiency disease (PID).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Immunodeficiency disease that arises independent of another pathologic process, disease, or injury._A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Immunodeficiency disease that arises independent of another pathologic process, disease, or injury.

Concepts.definition: Immunodeficiency disease that arises independent of another pathologic process, disease, or injury.

Property.preferredDefinition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for NCI-INC0536652 - 20C0070 Curation and import 11.10.2020 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.: An infection caused by a fungus.

Concepts.definition: Marked by a tendency to spread, especially into healthy surrounding tissue.
An infection caused by a fungus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.: Unicellular, prokaryotic organisms that reproduce by cell division and usually have cell walls; can be shaped like spheres, rods or spirals and can be found in virtually any enviroment. (BioTech Life Science Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Unicellular, prokaryotic organisms that reproduce by cell division and usually have cell walls; can be shaped like spheres, rods or spirals and can be found in virtually any environment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An infectious agent which consists of two parts, genetic material and a protein coat. These organisms lack independent metabolism, and they must infect the cells of other types of organisms to reproduce. Most viruses are capable of passing through fine filters that retain bacteria, and are not visible through a light microscope.

Concepts.definition: An infectious agent which consists of two parts, genetic material and a protein coat. These organisms lack independent metabolism, and they must infect the cells of other types of organisms to reproduce. Most viruses are capable of passing through fine filters that retain bacteria, and are not visible through a light microscope.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. 11.24.2020 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A group of signs, symptoms, and clinicopathological characteristics that may or may not have a genetic basis and collectively define an abnormal condition.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.: A living thing, such as an animal, a plant, a bacterium, or a fungus.

Concepts.definition: A group of signs, symptoms, and clinicopathological characteristics that may or may not have a genetic basis and collectively define an abnormal condition.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An animal or plant that gets nutrients by living on or in an organism of another species. A complete parasite gets all of its nutrients from the host organism, but a semi-parasite gets only some of its nutrients from the host.

Concepts.definition: Any organism that has a close, symbiotic relationship with a separate, host organism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A genus of acid-fast Gram-positive, aerobic and nonmotile bacteria in the phylum Actinobacteria.: A group of organisms that differ from all other groups of organisms and that are capable of breeding and producing fertile offspring.

Concepts.definition: A genus of acid-fast Gram-positive, aerobic and nonmotile bacteria in the phylum Actinobacteria.
A group of organisms that differ from all other groups of organisms and that are capable of breeding and producing fertile offspring.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
